title: Rate law from mechanism and effect of conc

content.question: Step 1: <math alttext="H 2 plus I B r produces H I plus H B r " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mtext>IBr</mtext><mo>→</mo><mtext>HI</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>HBr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> (slow) Step 2: <math alttext="H I plus I B r produces I 2 plus H B r " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>IBr</mtext><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mtext>HBr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> (fast) A proposed mechanism for the reaction <math alttext="H 2 plus 2 I B r produces I 2 plus 2 H B r " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>IBr</mtext><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>HBr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown above. Two experiments were performed at the same temperature but with different initial concentrations. Based on this information, which of the following statements is correct?

choices.label: The rate of the reaction will undergo a 4-fold increase in the experiment in which the initial concentrations of both <math alttext="H I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="I B r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IBr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> were doubled.

The rate of the reaction will undergo a 2-fold increase in the experiment in which the initial concentrations of both <math alttext="H I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="I B r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IBr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> were doubled.

The rate of the reaction will undergo a 4-fold increase in the experiment in which the initial concentrations of both <math alttext="H 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="I B r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IBr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> were doubled.

The rate of the reaction will undergo a 8-fold increase in the experiment in which the initial concentrations of both <math alttext="H 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="I B r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IBr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> were doubled.

content.answer: The rate of the reaction will undergo a 4-fold increase in the experiment in which the initial concentrations of both <math alttext="H 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="I B r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IBr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> were doubled.

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
